hints.content:
There are $\greenD{24}$ buses in $\blueD6$ equal rows.

![Same image with the rows numbered 1 through 6 and horizontal lines between the rows](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a5f783ca27df5638fa69de0047459092afc6b1f7)

How can we find out how many buses are in each row?

We can find how many buses are in each row by dividing:

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\blueD{\text{ number of rows}}$

So, $\greenD{24}\div\blueD{6}$

The following expression will tell us how many buses are in each row:

- $\greenD{24}\div\blueD6$

question.content:
There are $6$ equal rows of buses. There are $24$ total buses. 

![24 buses in 6 equal rows](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2fa42b1519604dd6d154ddc220d4f63fdf6ae95d) 

**Which expression will tell us how many buses are in each row?**
